title: Bug 12906[Editor Mgmt] If file is already opened in one editor, cannot open in another editor (should give error msg)
description: Bug 12906[Editor Mgmt] If file is already opened in one editor, cannot open in another editor (should give error msg)
OB: When a file is opened in one editor and the user attempts to open the same file in another editor, nothing happens. The workbench does not display any warning or error message.
EB: When a file is already opened in one editor and the user attempts to open the same file in another editor, the workbench should display a warning message. The warning message should state that opening the file in another editor may result in overwriting changes and ask the user if they want to continue. Alternatively, an error message should be displayed, stating that all files should be closed before opening the file in another editor.
SR:
To reproduce the issue, follow these steps:
1. Close the currently opened file.
2. Go to the Java Perspective.
3. Open a java file by double-clicking on it.
4. The file is now opened in the workbench.
5. Right-click on the Java file and select 'Open With' -> 'System Editor'.
6. Verify that nothing happens and no warning or error message is displayed.
